newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire rebel leader Kabila to address thousands.
newsitem.headline: Zaire rebel leader Kabila to address thousands.

text.p: Zairean rebel leader Laurent Kabila arrived at a soccer stadium on Saturday to address about 10,000 citizens of the country's second city, which his forces easily seized over a week ago.

The thrill of revolution which last week gripped the once elegant city, formerly known as Elisabethville, has been diluted by uncertainty, which locals say will not be dispelled until the leader appears in public.

Kabila flew back to Lubumbashi on Thursday from an overnight trip to South Africa, where he had held a new round of peace talks with President Nelson Mandela in an attempt to reach a peaceful solution to the six-month-old war against ailing Zairean President Mobutu Sese Seko.
